intro: Ortholoma filipes, commonly known as the slender ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Ortholoma filipes is often found in chaparral and sagebrush ecosystems, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
